articles.title: "Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works" Brought Out in Japan
Plan for Cultural Exchange Inked between DPRK and India
articles.content:
"Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works" Brought Out in Japan 
    Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- "Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works" (For Carrying Forward and Accomplishing the Cause of Juche) was brought out by the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism on September 9.
 Carried in the collection are 13 works made public by leader Kim Jong Il after the demise of President Kim Il Sung, including "Let Us Hold the Great Leader Forever in High Esteem and Accomplish His Cause" and "Socialism Is a Science."    
 The book in the preface said that the world people are now studying the Juche idea to hew out the revolution and construction of their countries independently. The collection was brought out on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the DPRK.

Plan for Cultural Exchange Inked between DPRK and India 
    Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The 2003-2006 plan for cultural exchange between the DPRK and Indian governments was signed in New Delhi on Sept. 18.
 Present at the signing ceremony were members of the cultural delegation of the DPRK government led by Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, the DPRK ambassador to India and the secretary for cultural affairs of the Indian Ministry of Tourism and Culture and officials concerned.

articles.content:
GNP of South Korea Denounced 
    Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The Taejon-South Chungchong Provincial Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration released a statement on Sept. 18 denouncing the conservative forces including the south Korean "Grand National Party" for urging the compliance with the U.S. request for additional troop dispatch to Iraq, according to a news report.
 The statement accused the GNP's representative of flying to the U.S. to let loose outbursts fully agreeing to its request for additional troop dispatch at a time when all people are opposed to the additional troop dispatch to Iraq. Timed to coincide with this, conservative forces are talking such nonsense as "the troop dispatch would offer soldiers a good chance to acquire actual war experience," the statement noted.    
 The statement warned the conservative forces including the GNP keen on cooperation with outsiders, flunkeyism and submission, will not be able to escape punishment by the times and history, calling on all the people to turn out in the struggle to check the additional troop dispatch.
